commitResults.messageTitle: Rename project from Duke to Icey
commitResults.messageBody:
The project uses the default Duke template name.

A unique project name better reflects the chatbot's identity.

Let's rename the main class and references from Duke to Icey.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add greeting and exit messages
commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot has no user interaction on startup or shutdown.

A friendly greeting and farewell improves the user experience.

Let's add greetUser() and exit() methods to display welcome and
goodbye messages with visual dividers.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add echo functionality and main interaction loop
commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot only displays greeting and exit messages without accepting
user input.

Users need to interact with the chatbot through commands.

Let's,
* add a main loop that reads and echoes user input
* add reply() helper method with indentation and dividers
* support 'bye' command to exit gracefully
* refactor greetUser() and exit() to use the new reply() method

commitResults.messageTitle: Add task storage and list command
commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot only echoes user input without storing any data.

Users need to track and view their tasks.

Let's,
* add ArrayList to store tasks dynamically
* implement addTask() to store and confirm task additions
* implement listTasks() to display all tasks with numbering
* replace echo functionality with task storage
* extract INDENT constant for consistent formatting

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Task class and mark/unmark commands
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks are stored as plain strings without completion status.

Users need to track which tasks are done and toggle their status.

Let's,
* create Task class with description and isDone status
* implement markTask() and unmarkTask() with validation
* refactor main loop to use switch statement for command parsing

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Task subclasses for Todo, Deadline, and Event
commitResults.messageBody:
All tasks are treated the same without distinguishing their types.

Different task types have different attributes (deadlines have due
dates, events have time periods).

Let's,
* create Todo class extending Task with [T] type tag
* create Deadline class with 'by' field for due date
* create Event class with 'from' and 'to' fields for time period
* add command placeholders in main loop for future implementation

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement todo, deadline, and event commands
commitResults.messageBody:
Command handling logic is mixed into the main loop, making it hard to
read. Task type commands are placeholders without implementation.

Separating command handlers improves readability. Users need to create
different task types.

Let's,
* extract command handling into dedicated handler methods
* implement todo, deadline, and event commands with input validation
* display pending task count in addTask confirmation
* shorten task type labels to single letters (T, D, E

commitResults.messageTitle: Add text-ui automated testing
commitResults.messageBody:
The application has no automated tests to verify command behavior.

Manual testing is tedious and error-prone when making changes.

Let's add input.txt test cases covering:
* valid commands (todo, deadline, event, mark, unmark, list, bye)
* invalid arguments and edge cases

commitResults.messageTitle: Add unrecognized command error message
commitResults.messageBody:
Unknown commands are silently added as generic tasks.

Users typing invalid commands should receive helpful feedback instead
of unexpected behavior.

Let's replace the default case to show an error message listing all
available commands.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor error handling to use custom exceptions
commitResults.messageBody:
Error handling uses early returns with inline reply() calls scattered
throughout handler methods.

Centralizing exception handling simplifies control flow and ensures
consistent error message formatting.

Let's,
* create IceyException class for application-specific errors
* convert handler methods to throw exceptions instead of early returns
* add try-catch block in main loop to catch and display errors
* consolidate bounds checking into parseTaskIndex()

commitResults.messageTitle: Add delete command to remove tasks from list
commitResults.messageBody:
Users cannot remove tasks once added, even if created by mistake.

Let's,
* implement handleDelete() with task number validation
* add "delete" case to command switch
* update text-ui tests to cover delete functionality

commitResults.messageTitle: Add TaskType enum to centralize task type symbols
commitResults.messageBody:
Task type symbols (T, D, E) are hardcoded as strings in each subclass.

Centralizing type definitions in an enum improves maintainability and
type safety.

Let's create TaskType enum with TODO, DEADLINE, and EVENT constants,
each storing its display symbol

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Icey class to use instance methods
commitResults.messageBody:
All methods are static, treating the class as a utility rather than
an object.

Instance methods enable proper OOP design and allow multiple chatbot
instances if needed in the future.

Let's convert static methods to instance methods while keeping
constants (NAME, DIVIDER, INDENT) as static final.

commitResults.messageTitle: Apply coding style guidelines
commitResults.messageBody:
The codebase lacks Javadoc documentation for public classes and methods.
Some lines exceed the 110 character limit. Switch-case statements have
case labels indented relative to the switch keyword.

These inconsistencies reduce code readability and don't adhere to the
project's style guide.

Let's,
* add Javadoc comments to all public classes and methods
* wrap lines exceeding 110 characters
* remove indentation of case labels relative to switch

This improves code documentation and ensures consistent formatting
across the codebase.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add TaskList class to encapsulate task collection
commitResults.messageBody:
Task management operations are performed directly on ArrayList<Task>
in the Icey class, mixing data structure details with application logic.

Extracting task collection into a dedicated class improves separation
of concerns and encapsulation.

Let's create TaskList class with add, remove, get, and countPending
methods, and refactor Icey to use TaskList instead of raw ArrayList

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Storage class for to save and load tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Adding Storage enables tasks to persist across application restarts.

Let's,
* create Storage class with load() and save() methods for file persistence
* add getters to Task, Deadline, and Event for serialization
* update Icey to save tasks after each modification

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
Add date/time support for deadlines and events
commitResults.messageBody:
Deadline and event times are stored as plain strings, which limits
the ability to format, compare, or query tasks by date.

Using LocalDateTime enables proper date handling and flexible display
formats.

Let's,
* change Deadline and Event to store LocalDateTime instead of String
* accept user input in yyyy-MM-dd HHmm format (e.g., 2019-12-02 1800)
* display dates in MMM dd yyyy h:mm a format (e.g., Dec 02 2019 6:00 PM)
* store dates in ISO format for reliable parsing
* update test cases with new date format

commitResults.messageTitle: Extract Ui class for user interaction
commitResults.messageBody:
All user interface logic is mixed with application logic in Icey,
making it harder to modify how the chatbot communicates with users.

Separating UI concerns into a dedicated class improves modularity
and makes it easier to change the interface (e.g., to GUI) later.

Let's,
* create Ui class with Scanner, showMessages(), showGreeting(), showBye()
* move DIVIDER and INDENT constants to Ui
* update Icey to use Ui for all input/output operations

commitResults.messageTitle: Extract Parser class for command parsing
commitResults.messageBody:
Parsing logic for user commands is scattered throughout Icey,
mixing input validation with business logic.

Centralizing parsing in a dedicated class improves separation of
concerns and makes the parsing logic easier to test and modify.

Let's,
* create Parser class with parseDateTime(), parseTaskIndex() methods
* add parseTodo(), parseDeadline(), parseEvent() to create tasks directly
* move INPUT_DATE_FORMAT constant to Parser
* simplify Icey handlers to delegate parsing to Parser

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Command pattern for cleaner architecture
commitResults.messageBody:
Command handling logic is embedded in Icey with a large switch statement,
making it difficult to add new commands or modify existing ones.

The Command pattern encapsulates each command as an object, enabling
better separation of concerns and easier extensibility.

Let's,
* create abstract Command class with execute() and isExit() methods
* create concrete commands: ByeCommand, ListCommand, MarkCommand,
  UnmarkCommand, AddCommand, DeleteCommand
* update Parser with static parse() method returning Command objects
* simplify Icey.run() to use the Command pattern

commitResults.messageTitle: Organize classes into icey package and subpackages
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, all classes reside in the default package with no structural
organization.

Keeping unrelated classes (UI, logic, storage) in a single flat list
makes the codebase hard to maintain and navigate.

Let's move all files into the `icey` namespace and organize them into
`command`, `task`, and `ui` subpackages.

This reflects the architectural layers of the application and keeps
the project clean.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'add-gradle-support'
Update Gradle config to use icey package name
commitResults.messageBody:
The build configuration still references the original seedu.duke.Duke
template values, which don't match our actual package structure.

Using the correct package name ensures the build correctly identifies
the application entry point and generates properly named artifacts.

Let's,
* change mainClass from seedu.duke.Duke to icey.Icey
* change archiveBaseName from duke to icey
* update Gradle wrapper files

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests for Parser, TaskList, and Task
commitResults.messageBody:
The codebase lacks automated unit tests, relying only on manual text-based
testing which is slow and error-prone.

JUnit tests enable automated verification of core functionality and catch
regressions early during development.

Let's,
* add ParserTest for command parsing
* add TaskListTest for task collection operations
* add TaskTest for task status and formatting
